subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Lean Startup Legacy
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Lean Startup Legacy usable.

hook.text: Since 2011, the lean startup has been adopted by governments, nonprofits, and Fortune 500 companies.

buildup.text: The White House used lean startup to rebuild Healthcare.gov after its disastrous initial launch.

discovery.text: The U.S. military adopted lean methods for rapid technology acquisition. Even the Pentagon runs MVPs now.

twist.text: Critics say lean startup leads to incremental thinkingâ€”small experiments that miss bold, visionary ideas.

climax.text: Ries responded: the method isn't about playing small. It's about taking big risks more intelligently.

punchline.text: Lean doesn't mean timid. It means smart.

quiz.question: What is a common criticism of the lean startup method?
options: It's too expensive for early-stage startups to implement
It leads to incremental thinking and may miss bold, visionary ideas
It only works in the technology industry
